vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
φωσφόρ-ος
(paroxytone), ον, poetry φαοσφόρος Lyric poetry Adesp. in [Refs], φαεσφόρος [Refs 3rd c.BC+]:— bringing or giving light, Ἕως [Refs 5th c.BC+]; φ. ἀστήρ, of Dionysus at the mysteries, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; αἴγλη, Ἦμαρ, [Refs 5th c.AD+]
__b substantive, ὁ φ. (i.e. ἀστήρ), the light-bringer, i.e. the morning-star, a name specially given to the planet Venus, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 of the eye, φ. ὄμματα [Refs 5th c.BC+]; φ. κόραι, of the Cyclops, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2.b name of an eye-salve, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__II torch-bearing, epithet of certain deities, especially of Hecate, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; φ. θεά (i.e. Ἄρτεμις) [Refs 5th c.BC+]; of Hephaestus, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__III φωσφόρος, ἡ, torch-bearer, title of a priestess, Κλεοπάτρας θεᾶς [Refs 2nd c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: light-bearing; (n.) morning star, likely referring to the planet Venus
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
light-bearing; (n.) morning star, likely referring to the planet Venus
light-bringing;, i.e. ἀστήρ, Lucifer, the morning star, metaphorically 2Pet. 1:19*
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 原意: 帶來光明, 放光
2) (實名詞) 晨星, 金星 (金星常在清晨時仍清醒可見)
3) 隱喻基督 #彼後 1:19|
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 原意: 带来光明, 放光
2) (实名词) 晨星, 金星 (金星常在清晨时仍清醒可见)
3) 隐喻基督 #彼后 1:19|
